channel.title: Comments on: PHP Tip: Spaces Are Not empty()

item.title: By: Rebecca
item.dc:creator: Rebecca
item.description: Thanks! This had me stumped for a while.
item.content:encoded: Thanks! This had me stumped for a while.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/03/29/php-tip-spaces-are-not-empty/#comment-3357">Sam Vloeberghs</a>.
That may or may not be what you want to do, depending on what legitimate contents of the variable look like.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sam Vloeberghs.

That may or may not be what you want to do, depending on what legitimate contents of the variable look like.

item.title: By: Sam Vloeberghs
item.dc:creator: Sam Vloeberghs
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/03/29/php-tip-spaces-are-not-empty/#comment-3355">Joseph Scott</a>.
Or use trim() on the var and than check if it's empty ( doing it the right way ) :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Or use trim() on the var and than check if it’s empty ( doing it the right way ) ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/03/29/php-tip-spaces-are-not-empty/#comment-3354">Airbrush</a>.
If you wanted to use a regex I'd do an inverted search for anything not a space (or space like character).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Airbrush.

If you wanted to use a regex I’d do an inverted search for anything not a space (or space like character).

item.title: By: Airbrush
item.dc:creator: Airbrush
item.content:encoded:
Hi Joseph,

How do you check if a value of a password field is all spaces? Been trying preg_match to catch all spaces but no avail. Preg_match can catch space within a string with other characters, but if it’s all spaces, it can’t catch it.

if (!preg_match(“/^[a-zA-Z0-9@#$%=]{6,}$/”, $value[‘password’])) {
…. error message here
}

Thanks

item.title: By: Viper007Bond
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/03/29/php-tip-spaces-are-not-empty/#comment-3352">Joseph Scott</a>.
Exactly. I would think whitespace would be empty() in PHP, but then I remember that a standard "if" test would pass with a space. :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Exactly. I would think whitespace would be empty() in PHP, but then I remember that a standard “if” test would pass with a space. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/03/29/php-tip-spaces-are-not-empty/#comment-3351">Viper007Bond</a>.
Good idea. I think the problem is that people come with built-in ideas of what 'empty' means, and it's not always what PHP thinks it means.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Viper007Bond.

Good idea. I think the problem is that people come with built-in ideas of what ’empty’ means, and it’s not always what PHP thinks it means.

item.title: By: Viper007Bond
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
How I remember it is that these two are identical:
[php light="true"]if ( $variable ) {[/php]
[php light="true"]if ( !empty( $variable ) ) {[/php]
item.content:encoded:
How I remember it is that these two are identical:

[php light=”true”]if ( $variable ) {[/php]

[php light=”true”]if ( !empty( $variable ) ) {[/php]
